front.title: DHCP Options for Distributed-Denial-of-Service Open Threat Signaling (DOTS)

abstract.t: It may not be possible for a network to determine the cause for an attack, but instead just realize that some resources seem to be under attack. To fill that gap, Distributed-Denial-of-Service Open Threat Signaling (DOTS) allows a network to inform a server that it is under a potential attack so that appropriate mitigation actions are undertaken. This document specifies DHCP (IPv4 and IPv6) options to configure hosts with DOTS servers.
